place.name: CWMYOY
place.gazetteerText: CWMYOY, a parish in the district of Abergavenny, and counties of Monmouth and Hereford; on the river Honddu, under the Black mountains, 2¾ miles NW of Llanfihangel r. station, and 6½ N of Abergavenny. It contains the hamlets of Fwthog and Bwlch-Trewyn, and the abbey of Llanthouy; and its post town is Llanfihangel-Crucorney, under Abergavenny. Acres, 10, 366. Real property, £3, 303. Pop., 649. Houses, 143. The property is divided among a few. The surface includes grand mountain and glen scenery. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £68. Patron, John Morgan, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: CWM BRAN
place.gazetteerText: CWMBRAN, a seat of iron-works in Llanvrechva parish, Monmouth; on the Avon-Llwyd river, the Brecon and Monmouth canal, and the Eastern Valleys railway, 4 miles N by W of Newport. It has a station on the railway, and a post office under Newport, Monmouth. A church was built here in 1860, in the decorated English. style, at a cost of £1, 265; and consists of nave and chancel, with tower and vestry. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: CWMTILLERY
place.gazetteerText: Cwm Tillery, 2 miles from Abertillery sta., Monmouthshire; P.O. (In 1887, John Bartholomew's Gazetteer of the British Isles)

place.name: CWMCARFAN
place.gazetteerText: CWMCARVAN, a parish in the district and county of Monmouth; on an affluent of the river Trothy, 2¾ miles ESE of Dingestow r. station, and 3¾ SW by S of Monmouth. Post town, Monmouth. Acres, 2, 875. Real property, £2, 276. Pop., 332. Houses, 65. The property is subdivided. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the rectory of Mitchel-Troy, in the diocese of Llandaff. The church was reported in 1859 as bad. Charities, £8. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: CWM
place.gazetteerText: CWM, a railway station in Monmouth; on the Beaufort branch of the Western Valleys railway, 18¼ miles NW by N of Newport. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

place.name: CWM FFRWD OER
place.gazetteerText: Cwmffrwdoer, hamlet, Trevethin par., Monmouthshire, near Pontnewynydd sta. (In 1887, John Bartholomew's Gazetteer of the British Isles)
